page.title: 05Parmiters Farm Machinery
page.content: {Parmiters}got its name from the person who started it in{1885.}His named was {Philip Joseph Parmiter.}It started on a farm near the A30, Four miles from where it is now. Mr Parmiter developed a small steam engine to carry coke and steel to his factory. They moved to its present position, next to the railway, in 1890.{One {hundred and thirty six people}are employed there and they come from a fifteen mile radius. About twenty five per cent come from{Tisbury.}Others come from Hindon, Salisbury and Shaftesbury. They make{agricultural equipment}and send all their goods by road. They buy most of their steel from {Sweden}because it is cheaper. They send some of their goods to{America and the{Far East.}They make two hundred machines a week.
